title: Part 1020 - INDIGENT CRIMINAL APPEALS MANAGEMENT PROGRAM
content:
Part 1020 - INDIGENT CRIMINAL APPEALS MANAGEMENT PROGRAM
State Regulations
§ 1020.1 - Application and definitions
§ 1020.2 - Fourth Judicial Department grievance plan
§ 1020.3 - Duties and authority of attorney grievance committees
§ 1020.4 - Staff of attorney grievance committees
§ 1020.5 - Duties and authority of legal staff
§ 1020.6 - Duties and authority of county and local bar associations
§ 1020.7 - Authorization to file charges of misconduct in the Appellate Division
§ 1020.8 - Proceedings in the Appellate Division
§ 1020.9 - Conduct of disbarred or suspended attorneys
§ 1020.10 - Reinstatement of attorneys suspended for failing to comply with registration requirements
§ 1020.11 - Diversion to a monitoring program
§ 1020.12 - Investigations of persons or parties unlawfully practicing or assuming to practice law
§ 1020.13 - Application to unseal attorney disciplinary records or for access to closed disciplinary proceedings

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
